title: Secretary General OIC-AC visits IMAC
content:
As the visit drew to a close, both sides expressed optimism for future synergies in the realm of arbitration and dispute resolution. The exchange of souvenirs served as a poignant symbol of goodwill, cementing the commitment to fortifying ADR frameworks and fostering regional cooperation.
This landmark development underscores Pakistan’s unwavering resolve to strengthen its dispute resolution framework, underscoring the nation’s commitment to promoting stability, security, and prosperity in the region.
ISLAMABAD, Jan 30 (APP):In a bid to fortify the dispute resolution framework in the region, Dr. Umar A. Oseni, Secretary-General of the OIC Arbitration Centre, embarked on a pivotal visit to the International Mediation and Arbitration Centre (IMAC) in Islamabad.
At the invitation of the Ministry of Law and Justice, Dr. Oseni engaged in a productive dialogue with the Honorable Minister for Law and Justice, exploring avenues to bolster Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) mechanisms and foster cross-border collaborations.
The meeting was attended by distinguished dignitaries, including the Turkish Ambassador to Pakistan, H.E. Nazir Olu, and Secretary Law and Justice Raja Naeem Akbar and the project Director IMAC, Ms. Aisha Rasool.
The Law Minister lauded Dr. Oseni’s indefatigable efforts in promoting ADR, acknowledging the imperative of capacity-building initiatives in elevating Pakistan’s dispute resolution landscape. The discourse delved into the intricacies of ADR, encompassing mitigation strategies, judicial training, and arbitration developments.
During his visit, Dr. Oseni undertook a comprehensive tour of IMAC, praising the institution’s unwavering commitment to upholding international standards. He underscored IMAC’s vital role in championing mediation and negotiation-based dispute resolution in Pakistan, heralding a new era of collaboration and cooperation.
As the visit drew to a close, both sides expressed optimism for future synergies in the realm of arbitration and dispute resolution. The exchange of souvenirs served as a poignant symbol of goodwill, cementing the commitment to fortifying ADR frameworks and fostering regional cooperation.This landmark development underscores Pakistan’s unwavering resolve to strengthen its dispute resolution framework, underscoring the nation’s commitment to promoting stability, security, and prosperity in the region.
